reviews.ReviewTitle: Phlipls cheap qualityplastic and poor juicer
reviews.Review: The juicer is of very poor quality plastic and material. See pics attached of new one and a 1 year old one.Philips in ruining their name with such quality.

reviews.ReviewTitle: Leaves too much juice in the discarded pulp
reviews.Review: It leaves too much juice in the discarded pulp and therefore a complete failure for my purpose.I returned the juicer after using it once.It is not the quality I expected.It would be misleading to give a high rating to durability, ease of cleaning and assembly since these qualities become meaningless when the juicer falls utterly short on performance which hinges on juice extraction.

I am writing a review here after using it almost 2 year. I really like this juicer to use it in my routine life. By using this juicer I make juice of carrot,  orange, pineapole, bottle guard and more... it is very easy and fast. The only one thing I don't like about this juicer is; it makes too much noise when juicing beetroot but still it is good choice in compare to others.

Writing after 1 month of use, Pros and cons :- Carrot and beetroot juice pic is attached.Pro's :-Juicer is super powerful.Build quality is good.Easy to use and cleanNo juice left in Vegetable residue.No need to cut apple and oranges and beetroot in small pieces as tube mouth is really largeCons:-1 liter juice can be extracted as jug provided is only of 1 liter and residue collector will be full after 1 litre of juice. Good for household appliance not for commercial purpose.But i'm satisfied with the product.

This is your juicing solution ...it juices everything even leafy vegetables ...u can put whole fruits and the pulp is dry with absolutely no juice left ...I am loving the product ...it makes good amount of juice ...very easy to clean ...

reviews.ReviewTitle: My machine's lower part got stuck after only 10 uses ...
reviews.Review: My machine's lower part got stuck after only 10 uses .. it is not coming out. There is no response from the customer service department. Have called them more than 5 times.

reviews.ReviewTitle: HR 1863 is the best juicer for the Range ₹ 5000-10000!
reviews.Review: This is an outstanding juicer from Philips. Its centrifugal technique makes it different from other juicers. Extracting juice from fruits like Grapes, Apple, Watermelon and Orange is not at all cumbersome anymore. Moreover, due to its centrifugal force technology, the process time has been significantly reduced as compared to other conventional/mechanical juicers. You can get 2L of 100% fresh juice in few seconds. Find the attached photos of Watermelon, Malta & Grapes juices for your reference.If you don't have the budget for Cold-Pressed juicers, then Philips HR 1863 is the best possible option for you!Overall, It's a great product by Philips. However, I feel there is still some scope to reduce the cleaning time.

We purchased in a hope it'd be better than others. First two days it worked amazing.But on Third day its lower part got stuck n glued on its own, we had to call the technician to get it removed. He took that out with the help of a screw driver after many attempts. He was also shocked to see n unable to give any reason for it.Second, it made very sharp deafening noise while juicing like it's churning some metals.Third, that day onwards juice started remains in the pulp.We returned the product on fourth day in great disappointment.

reviews.ReviewTitle: The motor is heating very fast
reviews.Review: We have been using the Juicer for hardly 2 minutes to take out Kakadi (vegetable) juice for daily consumption. But on 3 ocassions due to motor heating the sides were getting stuck - acrylic to acrylic. The juice was also coming out from the sides, maybe because the container was stuck. On the 3rd occasion when we could not free the container for cleaning, it was taken to the Philips service centre in Panjim and with great difficulty he freed the container and gave me the juicer.Posting pictures of where the sides were stuck (you can see the black pieces stuck to the side of the container) and a crack developed while freeing the sides by the Service centre.  I am taking the juicer back to the Philips centre for replacement and correction.

reviews.ReviewTitle: Good juicer but hard to clean and assemble
reviews.Review: Pros :I was skeptical after reading comments that its wastes too much, not sure what they meant, but its very very efficient and  leaves less pulps (tried apple, mosambi and carrot), overall very happy with juicing functionalityCons:- Hard to assemble/dis-assemble for everyone, I manage to assemble/dis-assemble but my mom struggles, it has around 6 to 7 parts which needs cleaning, due to its narrow and small parts difficult to clean tooOverall:Very good quality product, If you are going to juice a lot then its worth the effort to assemble / clean else you are better off with normal mixer grinder

I bought this product after Reading so many views, good bad. But I must this product of Phillips is Worth every penny, saves time and definitely not at all messy. That's y I uploaded a video to let ppl aware of this brand. Best part of the product is the seive of this grinder, it's a soft round plate of tiny holes, so tiny that only liquid can pass through. And it's very easy to clean, like you're washing a steel bowl or glass. Will update my review soon when I'll wash it. Watch video and see for yourself!

reviews.ReviewTitle: Good for household use. Do not buy if you want to extract every ounce of juice from the fruit.
reviews.Review: I've been using it for 7-8 months now. It's a good product for everyday use, specially for fruits like watermelon that have high juice content. Easy to assemble, clean and use. Also you don't need to fine chop the fruits or remove seeds. It takes care of that.If you want a juicer that extracts entire juice from the fruit, then you should research about slow juicers. They're costlier and aren't quick like this one. But will give you your money's worth. This is meant for everyday household use and provides best result from juicy fruits.

reviews.ReviewTitle: Probably the best Juicer out there
reviews.Review: Probably the best Juicer out there. Been using it 4-5 times a week for past 6 months and no issues so far. It is very very easy to clean in comparison to the cheaper ones out there. I received a piece with wear and tear first but Amazon promptly replaced it with a fresh one. Packaging could have been better.

reviews.ReviewTitle: Only look wise else pulp collection jar is getting welded to the bottom motor section
reviews.Review: This is not a wonderful product at all. Very poor quality plastic, but if you are impressed with look it's only you will find it very soon very poor quality plastic, and also as claimed cleaning is not finished in 1 minute, just look wise good product,, not for even daily use , pulp collection jar got stick to motor within few usage, got it replaced by service center, still after one use again due to poor quality of plastic the pulp container became welded to the bottom motor section and I m not able to clean it properly . I am using it from last  5 month 1 time everyday but hopeless product from Philips. Performance is not good, makes too much noise.  issue i found is when you put full lemon/gooseberry without seed or leafy vegetables it makes harsh sound. Also if you press the vegetables with little more pressure, fibre collecting tray get stick with the base and we need to force remove it. Takling to service centre they collect the faulty product and promised to refund the money back but Its 2 months no progress so far, money gone as well as the product gone. Very disappointed with poor Chinese quality plastic product. Do not buy this costly product, service center promise to refund the amount after 2 months of rigorous followups but my money has still not refunded even the service center technician already collected the faulty product. Please don't buy just by looks. Poor quality Chinese manufactured plastic

As claimed the process is fast and takes hardly 2 minutes to get juice of 700 gms of carrots. But residue pulp quantity is too much of waste and still holds juice as does not come out completely dry. Cleaning too is tedious as there are too many parts to dissemble & wash contrary to what it claims. Though it looks compact, technically I do not see much improvement compared to the old models by Brown or other old models of Philips.

The first one that was delivered ...in one use the waste collector part got stuck to the main body. In the first use. Thankfully it was still under return. So I called for a replacement. But I’m not fully satisfied with this product.1) the fruit waste has juice in it. So it’s not dry and hence some juice is wasted.2) the juicer leaks from each fitting which again should not be the case.3) and even the replacement juicer has a funny smell when used like rubber burning.! So I’m not sure what to do.4) also cleaning is not as simple and easy as they make it sound in the videos.. practically you have to remove every part and wash it with soup.Overall I think amazon either is selling faulty second hand Philips juicers or the product itself is of terrible quality.

reviews.ReviewTitle: Quality of juice is very bad. Request philips to stop this product immediately.
reviews.Review: This is the worst juicer philips has made. The juice that it makes comes out with big pieces of fruits and vegetables. It’s like big pieces of fruits and vegetables coming into your mouth when you are trying to drink the juice. I had to buy a chalni to filter the juice before it’s drinkable. This is the worst design philips has made. I knew there was a problem with this juicer and I committed the same mistake again. The earlier design than this one was much better. It’s so difficult to open the entire juicer and take out the pulp from inside. Please do not buy it if you are an ardent juice drinker and want it to be hassle free.

reviews.ReviewTitle: Not at all fancy when using..
reviews.Review: Pros:Powerful motor.Cons:Lots of components to assembleToo many to wash afterwards if not using dishwasherLeaves chunks of veggiesIt won't extract juice completely. It shreads to finest pieces but don't have proper mechanism to squeeze. So the remains will have so much juice still left. I use it for carrots and beets. For 5 medium beets it can extract only a medium cup of juice. May be a juicer attachment of mixer grinders perform better where we can add a bit of water too. Only useful if you don't care of the wastage and you have to juice large quantities. Not practical for smaller quantities.

Ordered twice & both the times- worked for just 5 to 10 min.Return was extremely painful, too. 4 different guys came over 4 different days to pick but refused as they all had a bike. Was that a joke ???????? Asked us to arrange for transport...Spent 3-4 hours on calls with so many agents & supervisors from their so called leadership team but most of them failed to follow up or resolve the issue. Finally spent an hour again on the call on July 13th, got the station in charge in concall & the da on a concall. Didn't hang for an hour by the time could hear the guy reaching home..Never in my life I had expected this kind of treatment from a brand like AMAZON..

It was delivered on time. One of the additional parts was missing. But, since all the necessary ones were there. I didn't make a big deal of it. First use- it was amazing. Washed the upper container and seive clean, stored it. The next day, it didn't even get started. I tried changing outlets, reassembled to see if there was something missing. It was all fine. The motor just didn't start.I paid 8k for this??

reviews.ReviewTitle: Such a Big Conglomerate and does not have the Engineering Intellect to make a Good Juicer
reviews.Review: -- Jumps all Over when started , one has to keep hand to keep it steady-- Apple and some other fruits does not get squeezed easily one has to apply pressure-- Jug is small-- The cleaning is not smooth as one would expectOverall Not a great product + Bulky

reviews.ReviewTitle: Check your product completely after buying.
reviews.Review: I bought this product after lot of reviews and watching lot of YouTube videos. The product is nice but I guess I have got a defective unit which has leakage issues. Every time I prepare any juice, the juice is leaked out of the juicer and I have attached photo for the same. Amazon has been helpful in providing full refund and returning back the product.

We have been using this for the whole summer now. We have tried to juice apple, grapes, oranges, sweet lime, cucumber, bottle guard, ash guard, beetroot, carrot, pineapple, and its been excellent. It doesn't do a grate job with grapes. With oranges, it do not crush the seeds, which was a huge relief.Cleaning wise the mesh takes a bit of time to clean but that is okay. Overall I am highly satisfied with the performance.

I received the package on time.The pack was open at the bottom.They have to pack it more carefully..At times we can hear more of the noise and vibration when juicer is working..juicing is perfect..done in minutes..Better to have one than having nothing at home for juicing..A must product if you are health concious..No need to have much second thought to buy one..worth the money..Have one to improve your health condition..you will enjoy the benefits..thank you.

reviews.ReviewTitle: Looks like there is an issue with the product itself
reviews.Review: For starting few days it worked well but later there is some issue with it's moter which is rotating on a very high speed almost close to double from the normal and making a huge sound.Looks like there is an issue with the product itself.

reviews.ReviewTitle: A good product for juice lovers
reviews.Review: An excellent product by philips for taking out fruits and vegetables juice for health freaks. Instead of drinking packaged juice filled with sugar and artificial flavors it is a good one time investment for juice lovers. It has a powerful motor and thus taking out juice of any fruit or vegetables a very easy job. Cleaning it after taking out juice is bit cumbersome process. I have mainly used it for taking out beetroot, watermelon, carrot juice. One good thing about this is that it separate out seeds from juice. I would highly recommend this product to anyone who loves drinking healthy juice even thought it's little bit costly.

Philips juicer is really an amazing product. Initially I found little difficult to assemble the same as I didnt find any instruction manual in the box. But after watching video on youtube, I found it easy to use it. As per me, a special thing about the product is, it makes fruits, vegetables and even hard vegetables like carrot, beet juices in a seconds. Cleaning is also very easy and less time consuming.  I feel, Its really a nice product  in India with a reasonable price and advance technology.  Happy with the product.

reviews.ReviewTitle: very flimsy clamp to lock the jar to the base
reviews.Review: One of the clamps which lock the jar of the juicer to the motor base has broken off and the juicer is not functioning. The bottom parts have got locked and are not getting separated. I am looking forward to know how it can be repaired. There is no service available locally which can address this fault. I am requesting Amazon to help me out by getting me connected to a proper service partner. Poor durability and lack of service of this costly product has raised doubts whether online purchase of such products, which require service, is worth the cost. My mobile no 7763807731, e mail : mailme.arvindv@gmail.com

reviews.ReviewTitle: if you're really health conscious and are ready to take your life more seriously
reviews.Review: I bought this product for my mom and for myself (in case if you're keen to know) to drink the finest organic vegetables juice since you cant rely the bhayawalas near neighborhood scratching their scalps, skin and making the juice bitter and sour which i like sometimes but still.Product does what it says here, its smooth, fines, easy to assemble but be careful with the blade though its too sharp and i almost forgot the EMI of this product.Buy it if you're really health conscious and are ready to take your life more seriously. I know its temporary but still, its worth it for a while.Close your eyes and buy this and thank yourself later. Never! Let life happen to you.

reviews.ReviewTitle: Superb juicer - far better than costly slow juicers - Must buy
reviews.Review: Made in China product. But it's a superb juicer. The pulp (especially for hard veggies such as carrot) is almost dry and powdery. Way too fast.It keeps the fibre so the juice is thick but way too bright with natural colors. You won't get such a color or taste in the juice served in shops or extracted using cheap juicers. Even a small glass of juice with fibre feels filling.I did extensive comparison with Slow Juicers with more than double the price. Slow juicers are good for leafy veggies such as spinach. Not good for extracting carrot juice - they recommend to soak carrots for 30 minutes to soften them. Apples get stuck and the juicer is required to stop and clean more often. And there is a marginal difference in juice quality in terms of oxidation as the slow juicers have practically no blade so no temperature - it crushes the veggies and fruits.The Philips one has 800 watts motor but I have never experienced it getting heated. It's so damn easy and fast - even a child with delicate hands can operate it.My kid loves it and keeps asking for juice. So it's a healthy alternative for the kids who don't eat veggies otherwise.Cleaning is not 1 minute but surely doesn't go beyond 2-3 minutes. Plastic is highly durable and of great quality.Service is too good. My juicer stopped working after 20 days (will not go into details but it's mot that juicer is of bad quality - it is not) and Philips technician replaced it with a new unit without even asking for it. Very prompt and satisfying service - i used chat support.Highly recommend.PS: I'm not easy tp please :)

reviews.ReviewTitle: Bad design and inferior build quality compared to hr1858
reviews.Review: The older model hr1858 was a lot better , this model is useless if you have to prepare 3-4 glasses of carrot juice. The juicer wire mess filter will have be removed and again assembled if you want to prepare another glass of juice. Also the build quality is no match to the previous version hr1858. It is unfortunate brands like Philips are also compromising on quality ,even if you are paying a premium for the product.

The packing of Philips juicer was in opening condition on both sides.  It appears company's packing was once opened.  It was not company's original packing.  However, since I have made 2 years extended warranty item was kept by me.  So far, the functioning of  the product is satisfactory.  This is for your information and future reference, if need be.

With a powerful motor, this lovely juicer allows juices to be made within a minute. I have worked this for carrot, doodhi, cucumber, apple, and mausambi juice already and its been a charm. Tip: put the veggies/fruits one by one and use the pusher instead of putting 5-6 of them together like you would in a mixie...

The juicer has given me good service through the time I have it with me.It is Sturdy and juices well.Assembly is straight forward. It might take a bit of getting used to initially, but all components fit well.I have used it to juice carrots mainly, but other veggies and fruits too, get done easily.The only troublesome part is the cleaning. But, I guess this would be the case for most juicers.Its sleek design fits well in any kitchen. So, it is aesthetically pleasing.All in all a good investment.

reviews.ReviewTitle: Fresh and easy juice! But check your packing!
reviews.Review: Nice and worthy product. Suggestion : should have enclosures to all the open lids and spaces.The packing was not up to the mark. All the airbags inside the brown cover (which was also tampered) were already bursted. No sign of handle with care and which side UP on the brown cover. Special instructions are must for delivery guys for such delicate products.
The whole family is in love of this product... We r Happy that we ordered this... It's super quick... Within seconds it makes one litre juice... It's not easy to assemble n clean...

reviews.ReviewTitle: Easy to make juice and easy to clean and powerful
reviews.Review: This juicer really user friendly and easy to make any juice and easy to clean

Finally a juicer worth all the money and effort.  Highly recommended. Good durability and very easy to assemble. Definitely way more easy to clean than the ones I was using earlier. And it squeezes so much more juice out of the fruit. The quantity however is limited to not more than 1.5 to 2 litres of juice at a time but it’s so quick to get the waste out that i can make more in no time. I liked it so much that I bought one for my mom as well.
Dont buy this juicer. Most of the juice is left with the waste vegetables and very less amount of juice is produced.

reviews.ReviewTitle: Great to use and easy to clean..
reviews.Review: A great product. So easy to use. Will take out even the last drop of juice from whatever you put inside. The fibre parts seem to be flimsy but since it is branded I feel it will last. But a little care while using would be great. Check out on You tube for the video.

Want to give 0. But there is no option. Only packing was good and product looked "cute", but it only looked good. It didnot even start. Don't know who to blame upon. Gifted it to my parents but now it has already spoiled the fest happines as we struggled to start it.initiated for return hope we get a quality product this time. Otherwise won't buy anything from amazon. Although products from flipkart, snapdeal cost a bit high but never had this bad experience with them.

It is a really bad product. I received it on 14th June. It stopped working by 14th July. Suddenly one day it just didn't start.Called the Philips service station, they sent a technician on 25th July. He said the PCB was broken, will come with new part and repair it. It's been a month since, no repair done after n number of calls. Philips customer care doesn't revert either.Stay away from Philips. They'll just take your money and not give any service at all

reviews.ReviewTitle: Difficult to clean and Pulp contains Lot of Juice
reviews.Review: This product can be quite challenging to clean if you are used to other models from National and Panasonic. It's a good juicer overall but a lot of juice is left behind in the pulp. If you reuse the pulp to re-juice, sometimes the thick pulp feeds into the juice. If you want highest juice extraction, you need a slow juicer.

Love the product, awesome and easy to operate. My daughter operates it best. Amazon at its best - delivered 2 days before promised date.Pros - all are prosCons - the wire/ electric cord is very short...could have definitely been bigger.Questions -Can we also use banana and chiku in it along with other fruits?

I’ve used this for over a month now and quite happy with my purchase. It is sturdy and the vacuum feet is a great idea. The juicer doesn’t move around when in use. It is a bit noisy but I suppose that can’t be helped. It does take a bit of time to clean, but I was expecting this so wasn’t a surprise.

I'm reviewing the juicer after a week's usage. It's too good and quick! Cleaning a juicer is never easy. So I don't count that in cons. But, one can still filter the beet juice in a tea strainer further to get water like consistency. Everything else is bang on!

reviews.ReviewTitle: Quite good but costly on the other side
reviews.Review: Juicer is quite easy to assemble and juices come out easily from fruits and veggies because of the heavy motor but after use I can say 90% juice is out but approx 10% is left with the fibers at the bottom compartment (for this I used grapes), at last the juicer is quite good compare to other simple electric juicers but yes this comes with a good cost too.

Good product but very poor after sale service , after some time the juicer stopped working , and when I took it to authorised service centre, they asked for some time so that they can replace the faulty motor , since it was not in stock ,they said it will take some time , today even after 6 months they have not repaired it , and now they are are saying that nothing can be done as the motor is out of stock !!!!!Very poor state , and that too from a reputed brand ,The product is as long as it last ,but won't recommend it due to poor after sale service

Hello friends, I am using this product last seven months and this is really doing great for me before this I am using many type jucer but some  difficult in cleaning and some difficult in using but this is simple in use and cleaning. Most of type fruit juice easily made in this but only citrus fruit is difficult because seeds are crushed and made bitter in taste. So pls clear all seeds before in citrus fruits.All over performance is excellent .Easy in use and cleaning.

reviews.ReviewTitle: Amzon id denying the product replacement .
reviews.Review: Do not buy any electronic product from amazon . it won't return it if having any problem. i bought this juicer 2 days back . when i ran it for 2-3 times , it is giving me wire burning smell. amazon CC is directly telling to wait 10-12 uses to , after that it will be gone.  it seems they are just waiting for 10 days so that amazon warranty gets over and i have to go to Philips directly. Now a days flipkart is better than amazon though they are charging 1-2% more on some products. At least they have better CC and policy in place.

It is a good product for the price and very easy to use as you can stuff entire fruit after only washing and moderately easy to clean. It is a little confusing to assemble at first but you get used to it. For this price range, I do not think there is any better option.

I got this product to gift to my mom on her Birthday n to my surprise there was a piece missing in it. There was no fruits/vegetable pusher. Such thing not expected from Amazon/phillips.I ultimately had to return product

First I have received a badly damaged juicer. The top portion is broken. And the replacement is sent after 2 days. However the replacement product is good. The extraction of juice is good. But at this price, the plastic used could have been better.

So awesome. Vertical assembly...other juicrs have attachments that connect side ways...in thos in this all the parts sit on one another turnout making it a tight perfrct fit. Less noise while juicing. Very rarely there are jams due to veggies getting such in the blade. But the box has Arabic markings on it so wonder if posts are available in india. Don't see this model on Phillips site.

I ordered this product after reading all the reviews from the customers but it is not up to my expectation. it does its job fully. I juiced out tomatoes and lots of wastage was there and we don’t throw away the pulp . Little disappointing

reviews.ReviewTitle: The Best Juicer Available in the Market
reviews.Review: If you are looking for a Fruit & Vegetable Juicer for your daily needs that is easy to use, quick to assemble, easy to clean and looks good than look no further. I recently bought this juicer after searching for juicers everywhere and i must say that this meets all our requirements. I would highly recommend this product. I have also bought 1 year additional warranty with this product to ensure that my investment doesn't go waste on this product...additional Rs 600 buys you peace of mind for another year.

reviews.ReviewTitle: A practical and easy investment for health.
reviews.Review: Very satisfied with the juicer. Easy to use, easier to clean as advertised. Seems like a very good investment for health.Only  gripe - It does not come with anything like a user guide - the pamphlet does not mention that to disassemble, you need to remove the blade and then the bowl. I struggled the first time till a Youtube vide by Philips made it clear.Amazon delivery was quick as always.

reviews.ReviewTitle: Returning or replacing is a hassle.Do not buy
reviews.Review: On recieving the product the machine did not start. There is no power running through it so its not switching on. On top of that can’t return or replace it directly from amazon.Trying to contact philips customer support service but not being able to.Don’t know where and how to return this product.Highly disappointed with amazon customer service and philips customer support service
It's amazing!!! Your search for an ideal juicer may end here.Easy to install, easy to use, easy in cleaning and best part 100% conversion of fruit/vegetable into juice.
Come on its not 100% juice still a lot of waste is generatedIs this the best juicer NOPEPaid 7k but for stuff like carrot or beetroot it wastes too much

Very nice...Quick and easy to operate... Clean the mesh carefully. Overall the product is well built and not at all noisy yet very powerful.If you like fresh juices and juice mocktails go for it without thinking any further

Easy to assemble, use and clean. It's a matter of 5 to 10 minutes. I Juice is pulpy and tasty. Very quick preparation and cleaning. Worth buying. I recommend, my other family members and friends, to buy this juicer and enjoy the benefits of taking vegetable juice every day.

This juicer is a good replacement for such ideas where you can at least have raw & fresh vegetable juices. Also we get pure juice which does not have water or sugar added.The only minus is the cost of the fruits now a days and some times the pulp makes me feel i am loosing something. But we have to pay for a good health so it is completely ok with me rather than paying for bad health later.

reviews.Review: Over all the product is good.  The only issue I found was that the base (Motor) and the pulp collecting part fit each other so perfectly that it almost creates a vacuum seal, even when small amount of water is present in between them and it becomes very very difficult to separate them.  The motor starts making weird loud sound when this happens.  To over come this problem I placed a paper/plastic sheet in between these two surfaces so that they do not stick to each other, this seems to have done the trick,

reviews.ReviewTitle: Excellent product and 10 plus year trust in Philips.
reviews.Review: We had been using previous Philips HR1861 since 10 years. It was marvelous. For Vegetable and fruit juice. Unfortunately top plastic cover broken and unavailable. So decided to go for another one. No doubt this model Philips.Advantage over HR1861 -1. Less wastage.2. More juice.3. Higher capacity.4. Best is low noise though motor capacity is higher.5. We are vegetable Juicer lover and use it 5/7 days minimum.6. Almost every vegei and Juicer including spinach, Cucumber, Beet, Carrot, Mint.7. Value for money compare to very high price of Slow Juicer where price are 3x times.

reviews.ReviewTitle: I have unpacked the product to realise my long term wish of purchasing this excellent product from Philips
reviews.Review: I have ordered Philips Viva Collection HR1863/20 2-Litre Juicer (Black/Silver) but what delivered was HR1864; looks there is no difference between these two. I have unpacked the product to realise my long term wish of purchasing this excellent product from Philips. I found HR1864 was nicely packed and I have assembled the juicer within no time. I have extracted vegetables juice using this juicer with so much ease and in lesser time.  The surface of the parts are smooth and there are no corners to trap particles enabling cleaning of the parts easy and just with a normal flow of tap water. The sieve was also made keeping its cleaning in mind. The sieve is very sharp and the one who handles should be very careful. Overall, I found the cleaning of this juicer is much easier as touted (advertised) by Philips. The juicer is more efficient as I got more juice when compared to  that from other juicers. I am delighted with the product & its delivery.

I bought this juicer recently and having problem with the side lever not getting closed properly, leaking and sometime doesn't even start. Poor Service by Philips Consumer Care @philipsindia without attending or resolving the issue WO160-0006043309 has been closed!!Now the smoke comes out of the juicer badly. Watch the Video. DON'T BUY this Product/Model.It is really disappointing, didn't expect Phillips to make such poor quality products!!

this is a great juicer. comes off better than any juicer i have used anywhere.juices all things equally well - fruits and vegetables alike.the pulp comes off as ready to throw. there is basically nothing left in there to use.might sound a little expensive but worth every pennyonly one thing i dont like about this is the placement of the blade. it gets a little tricky to install and remove (to clean) the blade. hence gave 4 stars. else a deserved 5 star product.

reviews.ReviewTitle: While all parts can be cleaned easily, The one minus is the iron mesh
reviews.Review: I recently ordered Philips juicer after reading reviews.Here is my experience with it -The juicer is very convenient and gives juice fast! you don't need to cut most of the vegetables and fruits, As the big mouth lets you feed them whole. The cleaning is very convenient, though not as fast as Philips claims. While all parts can be cleaned easily, The one minus is the iron mesh, you will need a toothbrush to clean it, as the fiber from the vegetables will get stuck in it's small holes.You can remove and assemble it really quickly & easily.The other con for this juicer is that it doesn't get all the juice out of the vegetables and fruits. The remaining pulp looked dry, but when I squeezed it with my hands, I got more juice out of it. I guess, one needs to buy a more expensive slow masticating juicer for that.To sum it up,+Ves :1. Very convenient2. Quick juicer3. cleaning is easy4. assembly is easy5. No need to cut up the vegetables and fruits, as it will take them whole with the large mouth.-ves:1. cleaning the wire screen is a bit of a hassle (needs a toothbrush). not too bad though.2. It doesn't squeeze all the juice out of the fruits/vegetables. The pulp still has some juice left in it. (unless you are willing to buy a more expensive masticating juicer around 20k, I think we can live with it)I strongly recommend this juicer, if you are serious about juicing!  Well built, quick and convenient for the modern lifestyle!

Bad product - hardly completed 2 seasons.Design and concept is ok but the motor is Chinese and started releasing smoke after a year of use. Please don't waste your money on this substandard product. Indian brand appliances are working much much better than these Chinese products. I hope Philips goes bankrupt real soon.

A wonderful product. I've been using this for the past month on daily basis, everything seem to work as designed. Although I was looking the bigger model HR 1871 for jucing capacity reason but this model HR1863/20 is just fine. My juicing experience has been fun and healthy ! The only challenge i came accross was the pulp holder capacity, if your juicing for 4-5 people you'd have to clean it at least 3 times. Having an external pulp vent would have made this Philips product fantastic. This addition would make this product a design to compete against. Overall my experience using the juicer has been worth the money and it's really been a blessing for my family.

And to be honest it extracts juice like juice shower ;p....just loved it...i would recommend it to every single person, who really love to get fresh juice with no fuzz of cleaning....cleanin is also damn easy...thats is the best part about it...especially for a lazy person like me ;p;p....dont give it a 2nd thought just go for it...

reviews.ReviewTitle: Great design and functionality - super easy to juice and ...
reviews.Review: Great design and functionality - super easy to juice and clean.Suitable for pulpy fruits and veggies which can go in as big chunks of fruit. If you cut the fruit into smaller chunks there is a lot of wastage.Also the juicer is not suited for pomegranates, it can extract only 1/3 of the juice from pomegranates as a traditional juicer.The density of the juices is not constant as can be expected and since it is not mixed in the juicer you will have to mix it afterwards. (essential if you are looking at mixed fruit juices.

Does the job most of the time (except with anaar). But leaves a lot of juice wasted in the pulp. Also the pain of cleaning is considerable. Don't think we'd use it as regularly. I prefer eating cut fruits instead. Useful only for veg juices given the effort involved and wastage.

reviews.ReviewTitle: Philips.. You need a lot to improve
reviews.Review: I was actually considering buying Hurom's slow juicer but bought this instead owing to good reviews I read on Amazon. Rather I say I was tempted considering it is one third of the price of Hurom's, and promising reviews gave hope for a good option if not considerably on par with Hurom's. But all my hopes received setback once I unpack and start with Pomegranate. I used three big Poms and all it extracted was a fourth of 225 ml glass. I know that extracting Pom juice is a tidy task for any juicer, but I was disheartened to see a lot of Pom seeds were left untreated in the collecting vase. I tried it with Beetroot and I found good sized bits of Beets untreated as well in there. I stand hugely disappointed with Philips on this product. You're not world class I understand, but if you can't provide better products atleast price them reasonably as per their standard.PS. The two stars are for Amazon. They never fail to impress you with their promising delivery and customer service.

The juicer is very time efficient and extremely easy to use. I have been using Philips kitchen appliances for years and they have always been worth the money and more. Making juice was never so easy. You just wash the fruit, peel it if needed (for fruits like oranges), and put the entire fruit into the feeding tube. No need to cut into smaller pieces unless it's really big. We make more juice now than we did ever before. Cleaning the juicer too is really easy. To top it all, it's absolutely beautiful. It's expensive compared to other options available in the market but it's worth every rupee. I highly recommend this juicer to anyone who likes to have fresh juice.

It's good for vegetables with high water content. Doesn't work for fiberous vegetables or leaves. My main concern is that the plastic dome looks stained and ugly even after a through wash. Quality of plastic isn't great but it's ok. My other company is that it's supposed to have a juice recipe book but doesn't have it. No use putting up a complaint even on the Philips site. I guess for this price range it's alright. Just wish they had taken care of the things I just mentioned. Go for it if you can't afford the high end ones:)

reviews.ReviewTitle: Workwise it's the best juicer available on the market
reviews.Review: Workwise it's the best juicer available on the market. My family used it for one year. However, after one year the black rubber material which is inside the juicer was damaged because of reaction with the acidic contents of the juice. We struggled a lot with getting a spare part for that product and finally couldn't succeed. Therefore, before buying this juicer keep this thing in mind. Otherwise, it's a fantastic juicer, but without that rubber material, you can't use it. We finally bought another Philips juicer with same but plastic material inside.

As long as the juicer works you will love it. But the moment it stops working you will have to throw it away. Philips has the worst possible customer service. I waited for them to fix it for two months. Multiple chats but at the end nothing happened and they kept closing my complaints without fixing the problem.

reviews.ReviewTitle: Very poor motor quality, short life product
reviews.Review: I used this product fot 2-3 months - and the fruits i juiced during this time were Oranges and Kinnow - and the motor died. I saw smoke and sparks coming out one day and immediately called support - the tech who came was quite embarrassed to see the product die in such a short time - given the usage has been as low as 2-3 times a week and limited to soft citrus fruits.I would return the product to the company if Amazon lets me as I dont think this would last long despite repair.In under 2years, the motor has conked off 4 times while we use it only for orange/lime juices.

reviews.ReviewTitle: and this product is so amazing for lazy people like me

It cannot handle juicing  of even slightly  harder vegetables  like betroot leave alone rinds of watermelon and bottle gourds. Be prepared to handle this nicer with great care and peel rinds of all vegetables and fruit of you want to juice them. This juicer is also not good at juicing leafy vegetables. They just pass through without producing even a few tablespoons of juice. Also can be very noisy.

Overall its a good product. Works well with beets carrots apples. Musambi juice without deseeding does not taste bitter.

reviews.Review: I have been using it everyday since Jan 27, 2017- all I can say is AWESOME. I am very happy with the purchase. The only thing that takes little effort is juicer steel mesh. Need good tooth brush and runnning water to get rid of small fibers stuck in the fine holes.I think it would have been great if company could make a small / sturdy bottlebrush that could reach inside the mesh (where the blade plate and mesh joins) . That's the only place I find fruit pulp might stick overtime. no tooth brush reaches that deep inside as the space is too narrow.Overall it's worth buying. gr8 product.  :)

Reason being, these fruits has more of pulp and less of juice in them. So, you get pulp (wastage) more than juice from these fruits. In order to get 1 full glass of carrot/pomegranate juice, you may have to take 15-20 carrots and  10-12 pomegranates ! I had to take back carrot pulp and put it back in juice and add water to it to make it glassful :( But note, that its not fault of this juicer, as it does its job of "Extracting ONLY juice".Hence, this is most suitable for making juice from fruits like Orange / sweet lime etc that has more juice content in them by nature. I made Orange juice (12 no.'s) that gave 5 glasses of juice and whole family liked it :)But still reducing 1 star just because one of the feature says "QuickClean technology", it is definitely not quick or easy clean as it takes good amount of time (10 mins at least) to clean it properly !

reviews.ReviewTitle: Love this juicer! Used for three months now and have no problems!
reviews.Review: I bought this juicer a few months ago. I am extremely satisfied with it. I received the product after a bit of hassle, as there seems to have been a problem with the delivery system in place at that time. I received it two days after it was promised from a very courteous and apologetic delivery person. My temper immediately calmed when he explained the situation.The product itself had a few damages on the box, but I was very happy to see all parts and instruction booklet available.I have used many juicers in the past, but this Phillips viva is the most convenient yet. It makes a few liters of juice in a few mts, with very little preparation on my part. Only the cleaning, washing and cutting of very big vegetables needs to be done. I juice whole cucumbers, lettuce cut into four sections (to fit into the chute), whole radish, white pumpkin, whole carrots, etc in no time. If I have more than 750 ml of juice I need to empty the juice into another container and clean out the strained vegetables in the pulp container easily. I have put spinach into the juicer with good juice output. Sometimes the pulp is wet, in which case I save the pulp till the end and reintroduce it into the juicer to get a few extra milliliter of juice (I guess I am stingy) this is why I have given it four stars.Cleaning, honestly I add water after the juicing is done and then dismantle the machine to thoroughly clean all parts with a sponge and soap and water. It cleans very easily, the strainer of course needs a light scouring under running water, but it cleans so much better than the old juicer I had! No scrubbing and using a bristle brush. No bits of vegetables or fruit stuck in the holes or the sharp parts of the strainer! No need for a toothbrush etc. it's so easy friends!I just love my Phillips Viva juicer and highly recommend it to everyone! I have used the Breville juicer at my daughter's house in the US and of course it gives you more juice and a dryer pulp, but this one is almost as good. It cleans well, gives more juice, looks great in your kitchen,  occupies less space and it doesn't cost an arm and a leg!

reviews.ReviewTitle: Cleaning is fairly easy but removing pulp from the side of the container ...
reviews.Review: There are juicers and juicers but this one is very special. These are my comments after first use:-1. Considering the efficiency of the machine it has relatively small footprint.2. It is aesthetically appealing.3. I have used the machine to extract juice from both hard and soft fruits and vegetables. The juicer has efficiently dealt with cabbage, beetroot, citrus fruit (oranges, kinnoos), ginger, apple, coriander leaves, pineapple, carrot, cucumber, karela, pomegranate etc. The fruits and vegetables disappear within seconds.4. The pulp coming out of the machine is fairly dry when compared to other centrifugal juicers. The slow juicers are more efficient in extracting juice and the pulp is more dry but slow juicers are more expensive and you need to cut fruits and veges before feeding them into the juicer, making the process more cumbersome and time consuming.5. Cleaning is fairly easy but removing pulp from the side of the container with fat fingers is slightly challenging. It takes more than a minute (as claimed in Philips adverts) to clean the juicer but you only need running water and no detergent etc.(This comment was made because I made the mistake of not detaching black panel with nozzle from the transparent pulp collector)6. The steel mesh has very fine holes. I notice a few fibers from fruits and veges have got stuck in a couple of holes and no amount of washing has been successful in removing them. This indicates that with regular use one would need to do very detailed cleaning of steel mesh every once in a month.7. I would like to assure those prospective buyers who have misgivings about the capacity of this juicer to deal with leafy veges. I juiced a small bunch of coriander leaves and the juicer effectively dealt with them. The entire kitchen was filled with fragrance of coriander and the resultant juice had distinctive flavour of coriander.8. The value of this juicer comes from the fact that raw fruits and veges can provide you with all the essential nutrients but all such fruits and veges cannot be eaten raw because of indifferent taste and high fiber. The cooked veges do lose some of these nutrients. Therefore, extracting juice is the only solution. Some of the ingredients of these fruits and veges are therapeutic and provide active cure for some of the prevalent health issues. Say goodbye to drugs and medicines with harmful side effects and embrace natural way to healthy living.9. If anyone of you smokes tobacco, give it up and replace it with a glass of juice per day and kill two birds with one stone as I am intending to do. It is good health at no extra cost.10. Finally, although you cannot put any cost on good health, I feel that this juicer can be cheaper. At Rs.10,000/- MRP it is expensive. I have purchased it for Rs.7695/- from AMAZON. Thank you.

Reassembling is also cumbersome and user must be very intelligent. I mean house wives will find difficulties in properly arranging all the compartments. Only safety point is that the motor doesn't work till not refitted properly.At the top of it the whole machine is so poorly designed that it doesn't prevent the entry of cockroaches inside the motor compartment. Every kitchen has cockroaches and they not only hide inside but may even be crushed during normal juicing. My machine was damaged by them. I ordered the part costing ₹ 3500/- but the authorised service centre failed to supply it even in three months.

reviews.ReviewTitle: Best juicer but do you really need it ?? Read..
reviews.Review: WARNING: VIDEO IS NOISY, LOWER YOUR MEDIA VOLUME.I am editing it after few month usage and would like to put a quick comment.. If you buy it..Just REMBEMBER TO UNBOX IT ON CAMERA because the plastic of body is really brittle..make it a habit for all expensive products.. Okay so this juicer sucks last drop out of apple carrot beat etc but when i tried oranges, the pulp was too wet with atleast 25% remaining. Many people in review says re-juice the pulp but seriously after spending a lot it cant do what a hand juicer can do efficiently. Still i am not going to lower the star rating. Its still good and smashes fruits within seconds.More than the product pros and cons i will write some basic points which might help you if you are thinking " if you really need a juicer at home "I answered myself yes I need a juicer because I used to buy and consume tropicana juices in bulk quantity. But I realized its still cheaper than making juices at home and finding variety of fruits in reasonable price is not easy in India , atleast in Mumbai.  Consider these points and then decide :1. Good quality 100% juices are available like tropicana , real2. Do you have enough storage space for fruits and vegetables you will keep for juicing. As it will always need big quantities for juicing.3. Do you have time and money to spend on finding good quality fruits and crush them to make a small quantity of juice.4. Even if you are health conscious, you are losing fibres if you are not eating the fruit and of course the taste which comes with bite can never be tasted in a sip.5. It will occupy some space permanently on your kitchen platform . use it or don't use it, it will sit there.6. The juice never looks or tastes good as in pack or what we drink at restaurants.7. Are you really going to use it on daily basis or atleast on weekly basis, no matter how expensive the fruits become ?? If yes then go for it .8. Some juices like, melon, water melon, strawberry you can make using normal mixer.9. I don't want to sound negative and discouraging so let me mention the main benefit of having a juicer is you can never consume 1 kg apples at once but you can certainly crush it into this juicer and drink 2 glasses or whatever juice you get .. All at once. So thats what you cant do without a juicer. Consume more and more vitamins without pulp and fibre. Also you can make juice of some fruit & Veggie skins which normally is impossible to eat & digest by human stomach. For instance watermelon skin which contains blood-building chlorophyll more than the fruit itself.Product Review++Its a good juicer for sure. It sucks the last drops out of the pulp++1.25 to 1.5 kg apples gives you approximately a jar full of juice. Screening the sludge is extra exercise.++Most of the fruits you still need to cut if they are not tiny to roll through the neck.++If you buy this juicer remember you should try to juice fruits and veggies as much as with the skin ON.++The parts made of plastic looks brittle and as people posted picture of broken plastic, I am very disappointed with this . why would Phillips use such material for expensive juicer! Why Phillips why !!++Its easy to clean but still a pain. Especially the meshThanks for reading this far. I hope this will help to make a decision. If you can afford easily, I`d say buy one and make a routine of juicing something every weekend. Despite all the exercise, its a very nice tool to have in the kitchen. Could be a very unique gift to old parents, relatives who are not able to eat & taste everything they used to.

reviews.ReviewTitle: Pleased with the Philips Viva Collection 2.0 Liter Juicer!
reviews.Review: I bought this as a present for my parents as they are quite fond of juicing.Out of the box, the product looked quite nice. One of the reasons I decided to buy this product, apart from the generally good review of satisfied customers who bought it before me, was the form factor. I really like the sleekness and elegance of the juicer. Some of the more inexpensive ones on the Amazon Marketplace - from Philips, Morphy Richards, Bajaj etc. - were of the more traditional style, which I felt would take up more space on the kitchen countertop, and frankly, don't look as good. Also, I happened to be walking around a D-Mart close to home and saw that the feed tubes of those Philips and Bajaj juicers were much narrower, and one of them also had a peculiar crescent-shaped cross section. You'd have to slice your fruits into smaller slivers to feed them in (which I suppose is not a bad thing, just a little more time consuming). The feed tube on this is much bigger, and can take many fruits whole.The product box had a Made in China label, but so far, I am quite satisfied with the build quality. The motor body housing is aluminum, while the upper detachable parts are thick, transparent plastic. It all feels solid.The juicer has four suction cups that hold the juicer down on the countertop and fix it remarkably well when it is being used, to the point that sometimes it's hard to remove it from the countertop. I didn't want to pull it off everytime I use it, so we placed it on a wooden placemat and just hold the juicer down by hand when juicing. This works better for me, but to each his own.As far as functionality goes, we have tried carrots, bitter gourd (karela), and green guava. It has handled all of them really well. The pulp comes out reasonably dry. While I'm sure you might get a few more drops if you squeeze the pulp for all it's worth, in my opinion the incremental gain it not worth the effort. The pulp is dry enough to be discarded (My father has stored the carrot pulp though, since he has an idea to make some halwa with it!). I noticed it more took more effort with the guava, probably because it was so hard, but the juice came out really nicely. We are planning to try pomegranate tomorrow.Regarding cleaning, I wouldn't say that it is a 1-minute cleaning job. All in all, the number of parts that can be removed - and should be cleaned after every use - are 5 pieces. Most of them can be simply rinsed under running water and come clean easily, but the stainless steel sieve requires some light scrubbing. The mesh of the sieve is quite fine and plant fibres with get stuck in it. A light scrubbing with some scotch brite is sufficient. So even though it does take maybe 4-5 minutes to thoroughly clean everything, the increased cleaning time is not really a deal breaker for me.All in all, I am very pleased with this product. I and would definitely recommend it.

reviews.ReviewTitle: ... and reviews I went for it but what a disappointment! First off the starting motor noise was so ...
reviews.Review: Having other philips appliances and by the ratings and reviews I went for it but what a disappointment!First off the starting motor noise was so loud,right then I had my doubts. I purchased it primarily for making ABCTG JUICE,amla beetroot carrot turmeric and ginger. Then the setbacks are that it produces very little juice from beetroot and carrot and the load on the motor while juicing these two makes it go nuts as if it's not meant to juice them!Then i noticed on the second juicing session while making 2-3 glasses that just after 6-7 carrots and a pair of beetroot the pulp container fills very fast then if you continue after that pulp and pieces enters the juice and the vibrations and load on the motor increases tremendously,and by now I have been only able to juice 1 glass! Pathetic!Then in the third season/3rd day while juicing carrots and beetroot,it started giving white smoke from the bottom!And finally on the 3rd day i noticed that the pulp container hat didn't come off from the motor base as it was stuck and that's why it was a frustrating job to clean it. Now I don't know whether I got a faulty product or a cheap one,but thanks to Amazon for a fast refund and in turn I purchased a Braun J300 and this thing is a quality product and now I am 100% satisfied!

reviews.ReviewTitle: Too expensive for what it does!
reviews.Review: Pros:1. Works well for uncut hard vegetables (beetroot, carrots, etc.)2. Comes with a juice jar that is very handy.3. The legs create a vaccuum so the machine sticks to the surface it is kept on.Cons:1. Useless for pomegranate and other fruit and vegetables. A lot of the juice is wasted. So basically, only good for beetroot and carrots.2. The waste compartment is really small and you have to keep emptying it if you want to keep juicing after 5-6 carrots and one beetroot.3. Cleaning is not as easy as advertised. No matter how diligently you follow instructions, you still see remnants of pulp everywhere, and you end up taking the machine apart and cleaning each piece separately.4. The vaccuum suction thing is annoying when you want to move the juicer. Also, this does not work on wet surfaces.5. Too bloody expensive considering the pros and cons.

reviews.ReviewTitle: Great Product. We use it every day
reviews.Review: Great Product. We use it every day! after about 2 months of use, we had to thoroughly clean the mesh soaking it in baking soda and stuff however, after that clean it has again performed very well.we generally make about 3 ltrs of vegetable juice for the entire family everyday and it has definitely provided and efficient way of juicing.

Absolutely happy with it.

The waste bin is very small. Do not accumulate waste of carrots for 4 glass of juice. However the product specification says it can remove 2 liters of juice. It may be possible for other fruits which has less waste like oranges, sweet lime etc. The earlier model HR1855 was very good which had an option to remove the waste bin from behind if its full.  This model has disadvantage that whole fitting needs to be opened to remove the waste. I am disappointed with this model as i love carrot juice only. However i m big fan of its old model.

After getting this product I am able to make juice every day ,no need to chop the ingredients fine as it has a wide opening through which whole fruit can be put. Great qualty product,well built, sticks very well to kitchen shelf while using as it has great suction feet. Good value for money . I am too happy with the product. A must for juice lovers in kitchen ....go for it. Thanks Amazon for delivering timely and for great product.

Product..is very useful for who seriously think of daily juicing. Yes I recommend that product. But remember if think of buying it through Amazon or any other websites be mentally prepared for to receive a damaged product or you may have to go for many replacement..i got a working product after my 4th replacement of the same product. It's better to buy from a retailer. As the courier miscare our products as it is heavy enough and very delicate and poor packing of Philips it gets damaged and cracked very easily. Even my 4th product also damaged. Finally among the fast juicers in the market it is one of the very good product.

This is our first juicer, it is simply superb, very little wastage so little that you can afford to throw it straight in the dustbin. It makes juice of all fruits, carrots very easily. Easy to assemble & very easy to clean. Superb job by Philips. Also thanks to Amazon for making it available & full marks for a great packing..

reviews.ReviewTitle: Pretty Okay! Just a few precautions
reviews.Review: So I've been using this for a bit now. It's a good juicer.PRO:- I've been watching a lot of juicing videos on YouTube where they have to chop the vegetables and then put them one by one, thankfully this doesn't have that. I've put in whole apples and a big fat lauki - juiced well and fit with still space to spare. So yay,CON:- Cleaning is a task. You've got to dismantle it, and remove the pulp, and then put it together it's quite bothersome.- I think the rpm is tooooo fast. But that's personal opinion.- The design could've been more user friendly.- It dances (more on this below)PERSONAL TIP:Like I said, this dances. On turning it on, it moves significantly. So if you switch it on after you've paused it while making juice, it will most probably topple the jar that holds the juice. My tip is to turn it on first and then place the glass under the faucet every time you start it.If this doesn't make sense right now, it will when you do it. But I think it's an okay juicer. Does its job.
It's a beautiful little devil. Worth investing for the sake of health.. Viva Collection is a piece of art. Strongly I recommend buying

reviews.ReviewTitle: It would have been a good investment, the price went up by 20 % ...
reviews.Review: I purchased this a few weeks back and here is a quick summaryThe documentation that was provided with the pack was not really helpful. However, once you know how to set this up, it is a pleasant experience.The piece I got seemed be an imported piece rather than a local version from Philips. Probably that explains the deep discount.The price seem to be fluctuating more than the Onion price this Sept of 2015. It would have been a good investment, the price went up by 20 % in a fortnight!.You can put a whole apple into the juicer and get the juice.Cleaning - pretty easy and nice. Can be done in less than 5 minutes for sure.I tried this juicer with multiple options - apple, carrots, cucumber, beetroot, pomegranate etc. The experience was mostly good except for Citrus fruits. I suggest the citrus juicer for citrus fruits and not this juicer.I give it a 4.5/5 !!!. If you can afford it, go for it.

This is something beyond my understanding. I have been using Philips products all my life but this one is an exception.It did not last even for a month and now I have to look for a service centre. I have been strongly contemplating between buying a Braun Juicer or a Philips one and at last now I know that I made a bad choice. Not a good product overall. Stopped working in 4 weeks!

You will not get 100% juice from vegetables/fruits but atleast you can expect more than 90% of juice extraction. I am little unhappy with plastic arm which holds all the part together I think it is weak. Cleaning task is easy if you are not lazy. Obviously it will take more than a few minutes it is not as easy as Phillips mention in advertise. But overall look is very good and very compact product for a small kitchen. I am using this product regularly for two to three glass of juice. It works good with hard vegetables and fruits (during this season we used it with beat root, watermelon, carrot, cucumber, bottle gourd, tomato, apple) but not so efficient for spinach/mint or soft fruits.

reviews.ReviewTitle: It is an awesome juicer from two angles.
reviews.Review: It is an awesome juicer from two angles. 1. Easy to operate and you can juice out in seconds. 2. Functional design.Remember this is a centrifugal pump, hence produce heat at 110 degree. Which means the enzymes are killed from the juice. If you are focused on your health then go for manual hydraulic juicers (Which are cold pressed). Those retain 97% of enzymes which are good for your health.

Making juice in the morning was always a big task in the morning. Pealing and cutting and then taking out seeds was a time taking job and after this blending them is in all a avoidable job.But with Philips juicer I never give a second thought to make a juice. I use it on daily basis and it gives me fresh without any wastage. I just have to peel n put the fruits in it and that's all. That too in a minute. No wastage - fresh - no time - very easy to clean.

Well in my case what to say 2 times I had issues with Philips Viva Juicer, First I replaced with another One and got refunded.I don't know why this happened with me, I think luck was not favoring me regarding this product, But I would mention the Customer service of Amazon India was amazing, first they replaced and still after I had issues with the product, they refunded my money, seriously very good customer service by Amazon!!!As far product is Good, it happened with me only, hope it doesn't disappointed others..

I did a lot of research to find a good juicer after my previous juicer failed. I found that Philips' juicers are excellent and especially this model is The Best in the market. So I bought this. I have been using this for a month and here are some of the awesome features of this juicer:1. It has a premium look.2. It doesn't occupy much space in the kitchen.3. Handling of the juicer is totally hassle-free.4. Any fruit/vegetable juice can be prepared within seconds.5. There is no need to cut the fruits before juicing since the feeding tube is wide enough to hold the entire fruit.6. It extracts maximum juice out of the fruits and vegetables.7. It can be quickly cleaned in just 5 minutes.It's really fun using this juicer and more importantly it's a great investment for a healthy lifestyle.

reviews.ReviewTitle: and it worked fine till it lasted
reviews.Review: I bought this machine in Jan 2016, and it worked fine till it lasted. Machine looks good and is decently company and easy to clean. But after a week of usage we noticed white smoke coming out from the base. It had a burning smell, and we stopped it immediately and called Philips customer care.Next day their technician called us, saw the machine and said everything is ok. The smoke and acrid smell was coming from burning of carbon which he said is normal during initial usage. He advised us not to run the machine for more than 30 seconds (then give it a rest of 2-3 second and run again). We disagreed with him and told him something is wrong with the motor. But he left saying he will only look into it when the motor stops working, and since motor was still running (even though with smoke) he won't register a complaint.Anyways, the next day more smoke came, and finally the motor stopped working.Now I am waiting for the replacement of the motor. I seriously doubt the build quality of this Philips juicer, and given the fact that we were only juicing  once a day, with just 2 glasses of carrot, spinach and beetroot, I would not recommend this machine to anyone.

reviews.ReviewTitle: Great juicer , but do consider the following...
reviews.Review: I have been using this product for almost two years and mostly daily. Its excellent for juicing hard vegetables such as carrots, beetroot, bottle gourd etc, even fruits such as apple, pineapple, grapes, watermelon... It isnt the best for leafy  vegetables (they tend to make juice bitter) but I use some for combination green juices such as spinach, celery, cucumber etc.Over all I am happy with the produce, there is very little juice left in the pulp its almost dry for vegetables such as carrots and beets. Cleaning is Ok, I am meticulous so use a toothbrush to clean the filter. Good thing its a metal filter.The only con I see is that at a time you cannot make more than 500ml juice and then you have to clean the pulp out and remake the juice only after cleaning the whole juicer and throwing the pulp out so its great if you are juicing only for a single person at a time. Else would suggest to go for Lequip ejection pulp juicer where you can juice continuously. Also ofcourse since its a centrifugal juicer with high rpm the juice gets oxidized and needs to be consumed immediately. So compared to a slow juicer the nutrient content is low. One needs to decide accordingly.It has a dual lock on sides after securing that in place only the juicer starts (excellent feature), however lately one of my locks came off and now the juicer doesnt start. Since it has a two year warranty, I am trying to exercise that and get it replaced, will update that response too once/if I find a solution.

Review is for the model HR1855, but the same applies to HR1863 since the plastic material used in clamps are the same.I had bought Philips Juicer model # HR 1855 on Aug 2015. The juicer is simply fantastic and juices whatever fruits and vegetables you put in. I almost started using it daily and infact got addicted to drinking juices.So why did I rate one start is just because of the pathetic service. The juicer though works great, has a very flimsy plastic material on the sides which holds the entire top portion. The tip of this plastic connecting to the body is very fragile and broke off. Saddest part is these clamps acts as a switch as well, so if its broken your juicer motor will not work.I called up the Philips customer care and logged the complaint and the service guy came home. He had no idea about this juicer and saw it as if he is seeing it for the first time. He spent around 15 minutes just trying to understand how it works. Finally I explained him, showing all the attachments and how it works. He then took the juicer with him to the service center and told he will update me in couple of days.It’s been 3 weeks now and still the problem is not fixed and I did not get any calls from the service center. Each time when I call them, I get a reply that the clamp is ordered and they have not received it still. I really do not know why it takes such a long time to replace just a small plastic clamp and they don’t even bother to call and update me.I hope the service would be much better in the US or other countries. Atleast I could see Philips responding to the reviews in Amazon.com. But in India, the service is horrible and the service person is not technical enough to repair such products. A product worth around 7000 definitely needs better support, that too when its still under warranty (just 3 months of use). If the broken parts are not covered under warranty, they should atleast replace it immediately when they manufacture products with such delicate plastic materials.I would not recommend investing around 7000 in this product which is having the most terrible service I have come across. If you are sure that you will delicately handle it and no problem would ever occur, maybe you can give a try.

It is a great juicer and satisfies all my juicing needs. I use it juice fruits and vegetables daily morning for my breakfast. I have been using it for the past week and happy with it’s performance. Lot of juice recipes are vailable in internet which I'm currently experimenting with.Pros:- Big chute and can accommodate fruits without the need of cutting them.- No nooks and corners anywhere in juicing chamber. So, it is easy to clean the accessories. It cannot be done in one minute as Philips claim. But it takes only 4 to 5 minutes.- Easy assembling and dis assembling.- Takes up little space considering it’s capacity- Looks good and stylish- I guess it is efficient too because the pulp is usually dry after a juicing session.Eg: It gives me two glass full of juice [400 ml approx] for '2 Apples + 1 Carrot + small ginger piece + small lemon piece + half cucumber'Cons:- Do not dump all fruits at one go in the chute. Instead juice fruits one after another. Because sometimes, you will l have to put extra pressure to get everything juiced if you dump all fruits in the chute at one go which may cause the overstress on motor.- Philips recommend using this juicer only up to maximum of 45 secs continuously before giving it some rest [like 30 secs to a minute]- Seeve tends to collect pulp in it’s micro hole. Normally most of it goes away when you start the juicer and pore water [300-400ml] into the chute. But still there are some left overs which you will have to wash it with a brush atleast once in a week for effective juicing.Noticed few comments where people have complained about hurting their fingers while trying to remove the seeve. The trick is to first remove the juicer spout and then remove the seeve [unlike what they have recommended in the manual] because you will be able to hold the seeve properly before applying little pressure to remove it.

Looks beautiful and performs as expected. My only issue with this product, and the reason for deducting one star is that the power cord is very short. This limits placement possibilities; your power plug needs to be very close to where you intend to use it, and I mean right beside
